data.text: Bank stocks finished last year on a tear, outpacing the broader stock market in the fourth quarter.

data.title: JPMorgan Puts Senior Credit Trader on Leave Over Use of WhatsApp
data.text: One of JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s most senior credit traders has become the latest Wall Street veteran to get swept up in the industry’s concern over the use of WhatsApp. Bloomberg's Sridhar Natarajan has more on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

data.title: J.P. Morgan Chase and Citigroup stocks rise before earnings
data.text: Shares of J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. JPM, +0.50% rose 0.5% and of Citigroup Inc. C, +1.27% gained 1.2% in afternoon trading Monday, while Wells Fargo & Co. WFC, -0.80% declined 0.8%, a day before the banks kick off the fourth-quarter earnings reporting season.

data.title: Bank stocks are cheaper than they historically are, says KBW CEO

data.title: India's Supreme Court asks crime fighting agency to seize local assets of JPMorgan: report
data.text: India's Supreme Court on Monday directed the government's crime fighting agency to seize local assets of JPMorgan  in relation to some transactions the bank engaged in with a local real estate company in 2010, according to a Press Trust of India report in Business Standard.

data.title: JPMorgan puts senior credit trader on leave over WhatsApp use: Bloomberg
data.text: A senior JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) credit trader, Edward Koo, was placed on leave as the bank reviews whether he broke its policies by using WhatsApp group chats with colleagues, Bloomberg reported on Monday.

data.title: Rise in Trading Activities to Aid JPMorgan (JPM) Q4 Earnings
data.text: Strong trading performance along with solid growth in mortgage banking fees is expected to support JPMorgan's (JPM) Q4 results.

data.title: Investment Banking Fees to Aid JPMorgan's (JPM) Q4 Earnings
data.text: Slight rise in investment banking fees are expected to offer some support to JPMorgan's (JPM) Q4 results.

data.title: As businesses hold back, U.S. consumers seen boosting big banks' profits
data.text: Consumer lending is expected to propel profits for big U.S. banks when they unveil fourth-quarter results this week, though stress in corporate lending and uneven capital markets may cast a shadow over results.
